#366 0' 2.1"
22.59 lbs. 		Sharp Blade Pokémon Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey. If battling dulls them, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

Ability Learnset

By leveling up

Level Ability Score Description
1 Defiant 8 Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
1 Inner Focus 3 The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.
18 Pressure 6 By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.
36 Hyper Cutter 2 The Pokémon's pride of its pincers prevents other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.
54 Sharpness 5 Boosts the power of slicing moves.
72 Technician 8 Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.
90 No Guard 8 The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.
100 Mirror Armor 9 Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By Disc

Disc Ability Score Description
Disc 01 Battle Armor 2 Hard armor protects the Pokémon from critical hits.
Disc 04 Insomnia 5 The Pokémon is suffering from insomnia and cannot fall asleep.
Disc 12 Sturdy 7 It cannot be knocked out with one hit. One-hit KO moves cannot knock it out, either.
Disc 15 Lightning Rod 7 The Pokémon draws in and neutralises Electric-type moves, boosting its Sp. Atk.
Disc 20 Rock Head 6 Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.
Disc 31 Technician 8 Powers up the Pokémon's weaker moves.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled

By tutoring

Ability Score Description
Analytic 6 Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
Berserk 6 Boosts its Sp. Atk stat when it takes a hit that causes its HP to become half or less.
Bulletproof 8 Protects the Pokémon from some ball and bomb moves.
Carbonize 8 Normal-type moves become Steel-type moves. Their power is boosted a little.
Clear Body 5 Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
Competitive 7 Boosts the Sp. Atk stat sharply when a stat is lowered.
Defiant 8 Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat sharply when its stats are lowered.
Full Metal Body 7 Prevents other Pokémon's moves or Abilities from lowering the Pokémon's stats.
Heavy Metal 3 Doubles the Pokémon's weight.
Hyper Cutter 2 The Pokémon's pride of its pincers prevents other Pokémon from lowering its Attack stat.
Immoralize 8 Normal-type moves become Dark-type moves. Their power is boosted a little.
Inner Focus 3 The Pokémon's intensely focused, and that protects the Pokémon from flinching.
Iron Barbs 6 Inflicts damage on the attacker upon contact with iron barbs.
Light Metal 2 Halves the Pokémon's weight.
Limber 4 Its limber body protects the Pokémon from paralysis.
Mirror Armor 9 Bounces back only the stat-lowering effects that the Pokémon receives.
Moxie 7 The Pokémon shows moxie, and that boosts the Attack stat after knocking out any Pokémon.
No Guard 8 The Pokémon employs no-guard tactics to ensure incoming and outgoing attacks always land.
Pressure 6 By putting pressure on the opposing Pokémon, it raises their PP usage.
Quick Draw 7 Enables the Pokémon to move first occasionally.
Rivalry 3 Deals more damage to Pokémon of the same gender, but less to those of the opposite gender.
Scrappy 6 The Pokémon can hit Ghost-type Pokémon with Normal- and Fighting-type moves.
Sharpness 5 Boosts the power of slicing moves.
Simple 8 The stat changes the Pokémon receives are doubled.
Slow Start -5 For five turns, the Pokémon's Attack and Speed stats are halved.
Stall -2 The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
Stalwart 2 Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon's Abilities and moves that draw in moves.
Steadfast 2 The Pokémon's determination boosts the Speed stat each time the Pokémon flinches.
Steelworker 7 Powers up Steel-type moves.
Super Luck 5 The Pokémon is so lucky that the critical-hit ratios of its moves are boosted.
Telepathy 2 Anticipates an ally's attack and dodges it.
Truant -5 The Pokémon can't use a move if it had used a move on the previous turn.
  • Bold indicates a default ability if multiple abilities are disabled
  • Italic indicates hidden ability if multiple abilities are disabled
